intro: Mansoa parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered mansoa, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a soft, velvety texture. Mansoa parvifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
